description:
Two assassins face off. The cool bounty hunter Chateau and the mysterious and powerful Ryang-ha. Chateau and Ryang-ha become enemies after this fight—at least, they should have, but for some reason Ryang-ha takes a liking to Chateau and begins following her around.

Little by little, Chateau develops a cooperative partnership with Ryang-ha, which gets her caught up in the struggle against the organizations hunting him down. Furthermore, that battle is related to her past as well. Two mismatched assassins weave together a twisted "Assassin X Assassin" thriller. The strange gears of fate begin to move.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

Note: The first episode had an early premiere at AnimeNYC 2021.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Ships
tags.description: Prominently features the use of sea-based transportation vessels.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

node.description:
Originating from M.S.C.

_Note: Not to be confused with either the CG artist or the sound producer._

Originating from M.S.C.

_Note: Not to be confused with either the CG artist or the sound producer._
She is currently working at MADBOX.
__Aiko Yamagami__ is a Japanese color designer and digital painter.
Kimura Kashiko is an editor working for Mad Box.

**Height:** 176 cm (5'9)

[Website](https://www.toshikimasuda.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ToshikiMasuda38) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/toshi.m38/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCx47ourWgyHf3iAl77MYY0g/featured)

__Non-Anime Roles:__

- Rover - Wuthering Waves (VG)
- Masayoshi Tanimura - Yakuza 4 Remastered

[Website](https://kobayashiaika.jp/s/n85/?ima=2313) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/aikyan_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kyanstagram_/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCNG7L36HtofjQk0FduxLxpw)

She's good at dancing. Her father is Japanese, while her mother is half Japanese and Korean. She learned ballet at the age of 5 and hip hop at third year of elementary school.

In 2011, she debuted as a singer for TV anime [Freezing](https://anilist.co/anime/9367/Freezing/) ending theme, "Kimi o Mamoritai" (君を守りたい) and was released as a split single with its opening theme. In 2012, she released a single for TV anime [Queen's Blade Rebellion](https://anilist.co/anime/11859/Queens-Blade-Rebellion/) ending theme, "Future is Serious". Both singles are released under Media Factory's record labels.

In 2015, she debuted as a voice actress with [Love Live! Sunshine!!](https://anilist.co/anime/21584/Love-Live-Sunshine/) as [Yoshiko Tsushima](https://anilist.co/character/89849/Yoshiko-Tsushima). She belongs to the idol group Aqours and its sub unit Guilty Kiss along with Rikako Aida and Aina Suzuki. She is nicknamed "Aikyan" by both fans and Aqours members.

In November 2016, she was announced to be one of the permanent hosts in Love Live! Sunshine!!'s radio program along with Anju Inami and Arisa Komiya.

Designed [her own parka](https://vvstore.jp/feature/detail/12383/).
__Tomokazu Tashiro__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and member of the music production team [Q-MHz](https://anilist.co/staff/156926/QMHz).
__Tomokazu Tashiro__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and member of the music production team [Q-MHz](https://anilist.co/staff/156926/QMHz).

__[Website](https://www.tsubasanium.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tsubasacurry)__ 

__Tsubasa Itou__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and orchestrator.

__Founded:__ 2015

__[Artist Profile (TOY'S FACTORY)](https://www.toysfactory.co.jp/artist/q_mhz)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/QMHz_info)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCUKcdgw725jOdQ6LfQNYZsA)__

__Introduction:__
Q-MHz is a Japanese music production team, consisting of various people from different bands.

__Members:__
- [Tomoya Tabuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/148232/Tomoya-Tabuchi), from the band [UNISON SQURE GARDEN](https://anilist.co/staff/119406/Unison-Square-Garden)
- [Tomokazu Tashiro](https://anilist.co/staff/148496)
- [Aki Hata](https://anilist.co/staff/106018), from the band Tsukihiko
- [Katsuhiko Kurosu](https://anilist.co/staff/149133), from the music production company [Peak A Soul+](https://www.peakasoul.net/)

__Founded:__ 2015

__[Artist Profile (TOY'S FACTORY)](https://www.toysfactory.co.jp/artist/q_mhz)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/QMHz_info)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCUKcdgw725jOdQ6LfQNYZsA)__
